intro: Meliosma clandestina, commonly known as the hidden meliosma, is a rare and understudied plant species native to the dense, humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliosmaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring broad, ovate leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which are pollinated by specific insect species. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature, contributing to its limited distribution. Due to habitat destruction, Meliosma clandestina is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
